metadata.title: CVE-2024-47879 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
OpenRefine is a free, open source tool for working with messy data. Priorto version 3.8.3, lack of cross-site request forgery protection on the`preview-expression` command means that visiting a malicious website couldcause an attacker-controlled expression to be executed. The expression cancontain arbitrary Clojure or Python code. The attacker must know a validproject ID of a project that contains at least one row, and the attackermust convince the victim to open a malicious webpage. Version 3.8.3 fixesthe issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-47879` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openrefine - 3.5.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openrefine package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
